Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • Character

  • public final class Character
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Alive()
      This function checks to see if the player is still alive.
      int attack()
      This function is for the player to attack
      void defend(Enemy enemy)
      This function is for the defense from the enemy It also checks for if the player is dead
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      This function gets the description of the character so that it can be iterated to the user.
      java.lang.String getStatus()
      This checks the status of the player.
      void heal()
      This function is for healing the player when a potion is used.
      static Character newInstance()
      This creates a new instance of the Character object
      java.lang.String toString()
      This is used to transfer any reference to the character's name into a string of that name.

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public int attack()
        This function is for the player to attack
        Returns:
        a random amount of damage

      • defend

        public void defend(Enemy enemy)
        This function is for the defense from the enemy It also checks for if the player is dead
        Parameters:
        enemy -

      • heal

        public void heal()
        This function is for healing the player when a potion is used. It checks the number of potions to make sure that healing can be done and then it applies that potion's healing effect if applicable.

      • Alive

        public boolean Alive()
        This function checks to see if the player is still alive.
        Returns:
        true or false if HP > 0

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        This checks the status of the player.
        Returns:
        Current HP.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This is used to transfer any reference to the character's name into a string of that name.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        This function gets the description of the character so that it can be iterated to the user.

      • newInstance

        This creates a new instance of the Character object
        Returns:
        new instance of Character.
